subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=dì
|m-s=
|dg=ди3
|c=dei6,dei6-2,deng6
|c_note=deng6 - usually written as {{zh-l|埞}}
|c-t=ei5,ei5*
|g=ti5
|h=pfs=thi;gd=ti4
|j=di3
|mb=dī
|md=dê
|mn=xm,qz,tp,lk,km,mg,hc,tc:tōe/ml,kh,tn,yl:tē/lk:tǒe/sx:tēre/tī/xm,zz,tw:tè/qz:tèr
|mn_note=Xiamen, Quanzhou: tōe - vernacular; tē - literary
Zhangzhou, Taiwan: tē/tōe/tǒe/tēre - literary
Other readings: tī - vernacular (may be considered literary, only used in {{zh-l|*土地公}}); tè/tèr - vernacular (limited, e.g. {{zh-l|*到地}}, {{zh-l|*鎮地}}, {{zh-l|*掃地}}, possibly substitute for {{zh-l|帶*}})
|mn-t=di7/do3
|mn-t_note=di7 - literary; do3 - vernacular (e.g. {{zh-l|*洗地}}, {{zh-l|*掃地}}, {{zh-l|*鎮地}})
|w=3di
|x=di5
|mc=y
|oc=y
|ma=y
|cat=n
}}

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
Possibly the same word as {{zh-l|*的}}, the possessive marker ({{zh-ref|Wang, 1958}}), but scholars like {{zh-ref|Lü (1943)}} and {{zh-ref|Yuan et al. (1996)}} are hesitant about this etymology.

Alternatively, {{zh-ref|Ōta (2003)}} proposes that it is a grammaticalization of etymology 1. The construction ADJ + {{lang|zh|地}} would have semantically developed as follows: "a ADJ place" → "in a ADJ place" → "in a ADJ manner".

subSections.title: Definitions
Usage notes
subSections.text: * This suffix is accompanied by a tone change in the reduplicated word, where the second occurrence is changed to the second tone (unless its original tone is the first or second tone), as seen in the examples above.
